info.title: FHIR AllergyIntolerance resource API documentation
info.description: Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR, pronounced "Fire") defines a set of "Resources" that represent granular clinical concepts. The resources can be managed in isolation, or aggregated into complex documents. Technically, FHIR is designed for the web; the resources are based on simple XML or JSON structures, with an http-based RESTful protocol where each resource has predictable URL. Where possible, open internet standards are used for data representation.

get.description:
Returns AllergyIntolerances based on filter criteria OR Provides provision for pagination (stateid, page, page_size, _pretty & _bundletype are query parameters used for Paging).

FHIR documentation for AllergyIntolerance.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: _content
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's data using a fulltext search

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The resource identity

parameters.name: _language
parameters.description: The resource language

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: Only return resources which were last updated as specified by the given range. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given profile

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given security labels

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given tag

parameters.name: _text
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's narrative using a fulltext search

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: food | medication | environment | other - Category of Substance

parameters.name: criticality
parameters.description: low | high | unable-to-assess

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: When recorded. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: External ids for this item

parameters.name: last-date
parameters.description: Date(/time) of last known occurrence of a reaction. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: manifestation
parameters.description: Clinical symptoms/signs associated with the Event

parameters.name: onset
parameters.description: Date(/time) when manifestations showed. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Who the sensitivity is for

parameters.name: recorder
parameters.description: Who recorded the sensitivity

parameters.name: reporter
parameters.description: Source of the information about the allergy

parameters.name: route
parameters.description: How the subject was exposed to the substance

parameters.name: severity
parameters.description: mild | moderate | severe (of event as a whole)

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: active | unconfirmed | confirmed | inactive | resolved | refuted | entered-in-error

parameters.name: substance
parameters.description: Substance, (or class) considered to be responsible for risk

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: allergy | intolerance - Underlying mechanism (if known)

put.description:
The conditional update interaction is used to update an existing AllergyIntolerance based on some identification criteria, rather than by logical id.
